comments.body: Can different composite projects have different values for the option?
Yeah, in the same way that multiple projects can in theory have differing `extendedDiagnostics` settings, I guess.
So what happens?  Separate trace for each project?

I've just pushed a change so it should just make one trace for the whole build-mode invocation, since we can only really have one live cpu profile going at a time anyway. The `enableCPUProfiler` and `disableCPUProfiler` functions now return a `boolean` indicating if they actually (began to) enable/disable on that call.
Error host doesn't support option if `!sys.enableCPUProfiler` ?
Should it? It's essentially just a diagnostics flag.
Interesting. Should we intentionally be ignoring this in --b mode? Should it error when invoked without tsconfig file?
I think it could be fine without a config file - serves as a fine way to convert a response file or other command line args to a tsconfig.
Afaik it is ignored in `-b` mode; iirc that bails out way early on in the command line parser, since it has its own subset of args.
I think we could have this even in --b just like how we have eg (list files, list emitted files) could be good information I think. Especially in verbose mode?
